collar.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over
collar.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He grabbed me by the collar.
He loosened his collar and tie.
collar.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a narrow band of leather or plastic that is fastened around an animal’s neck
collar.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an object that someone wears around their neck to support it when it has been injured
collar.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a way of making sure that stocks you own do not lose money, even if their price goes down
collar.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a circular ring that goes round a pipe to make it stronger, especially where two pipes join together
collar.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a band of fur, feathers, or skin around an animal’s neck that is a different colour from the rest of the animal
collar.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape
collar.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The police collared him less than 20 minutes after the robbery.
collar.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to find someone so that you can talk to them, especially when they would prefer to avoid you
collar.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He collared her in the staff room at lunchtime and started telling her about his holiday plans.
